business.headline: Once-dominant online job boards CareerBuilder, Monster go bankruptCreated through the September merger of CareerBuilder and Monster, the Chicago-based company said it agreed to sell its job board operations, its most recognisable business, to JobGet, which has an app for so-called gig workers.

Filed the wrong ITR form? Penalties, missed refunds and what to do nextWhether you're a salaried professional, freelancer, or a business owner, choosing the right ITR (Income Tax Return) form is important. Getting it wrong might mean missed refunds, penalties, or worse, your return being treated as invalid.

Sensex ends 1,000 points higher, Nifty above 25,500; Tata Steel gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,000.36 points to end at 83,755.87, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 304.25 points to close at 25,549.00.

From phones to partners: 8 money lessons to learn before 30Managing money isn't just about making budgets, it's about making better choices, every single day. CA Nitin Kaushik shares eight crucial money lessons that everyone should grasp by the age of 30.

Are your savings at risk? Government may slash PPF, NSC rates next weekSo far this year, interest rates for schemes such as Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY), Senior Citizens Savings Scheme (SCSS), and Post Office term deposits have remained unchanged. However, this may not continue in the next quarter.

Housing sales drop 20% across top 7 cities in Q2 2025 as prices stay highA sluggish Q2 masked early signs of recovery in India's housing market, with rising prices, cautious buyers, and skewed supply dampening sales—but softening rates and easing tensions may turn the tide.

Hiding income or making wrong claims? Your ITR could attract a 200% penaltyThe recent changes in Income Tax Return (ITR) regulations highlight stricter penalties for incorrect filings, including a potential 200% penalty on false claims.

Roti, kapda, but no makaan? The disappearing dream of affordable housingAffordable housing is vanishing from India's cities, and the crisis runs deeper than shrinking supply. In this deep dive, we explore how rising costs, fading supply, and policy gaps are shutting the door on millions chasing the ownership dream.

How expensive a house should you buy? Investment banker shares these 6 rulesAn investment banker lays down six clear, conservative rules for home buying to help first-time buyers avoid the trap of overleveraged homeownership.

Received Form 16? Don't file your ITR without checking these pointsForm 16 is a certificate your employer gives you every year. It shows how much salary you earned in the financial year and how much tax was deducted from it. This tax is called TDS (Tax Deducted at Source).

Nvidia overtakes Microsoft as world's most valuable company after 4% surgeNvidia's shares touched a new record high of $154.10, after climbing 4.33% during the trading session. This rally followed a positive report from Loop Capital, which raised its price target for Nvidia from $175 to $250.

Sensex rises over 500 points, crosses 83,000: Why is stock market rising today?By 9:59 am, the Sensex had gained 549 points to touch 83,305.06, while the Nifty rose by 172.75 points to 25,417.50. The mood across the broader market was upbeat, and volatility remained surprisingly muted.

entertainment.headline: Kamal Haasan, Ayushmann among 534 people invited to join Academy for Oscar votingIndian actors Kamal Haasan, Ayushmann Khurrana, filmmaker Payal Kapadia, singer-actor Ariana Grande and 531 people from across the globe have been invited to join The Academy. Upon acceptation, the members will be able to cast their vote for Oscars.
'Mission: Impossible' composer Lalo Schifrin dies at 93Lalo Schifrin, Grammy-winning composer of the iconic Mission: Impossible theme, dies at 93 after a legendary music career.

Squid Game Season 3: Front man's identity fuels deadly showdown in final chapterSquid Game Season 3, the final chapter, premieres June 27 on Netflix. With only six episodes, it continues Gi-hun's battle against the Front Man in the deadliest round of games yet.

Allison Williams marries Alexander Dreymon after years of private romanceAllison Williams and Alexander Dreymon recently married after years of keeping their relationship private. The couple shares a son and continues to guard their personal life while fans celebrate their union.

Anna Wintour steps down as US Vogue's editor-in-chief after 37 yearsAnna Wintour updated Vogue by mixing luxury fashion with street style and featuring celebrities. She also supported new designers and helped launch Vogue editions around the world.

Kareena Kapoor ate parathas during Tashan, jokes about Katrina Kaif's only salmon dietActor Kareena Kapoor Khan spoke about having parathas for breakfast during the filming of her film 'Tashan' in a conversation with actor Vicky Kaushal. She also joked about actor Katrina Kaif's 'Dhoom phase' when she was on 'only salmon' diet.

Rana Daggubati joins Ram Pothineni's next as producerRana Daggubati has teamed up with the makers of 'Baahubali' to support Ram Pothineni's forthcoming film. The announcement of the film is yet to be made.

Mika Singh says Diljit Dosanjh isn't matured enough, wants him to apologiseMika Singh exclusively spoke to India Today, expressing his disappointment in singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh, amid 'Sardaar Ji 3' row. He urged Dosanjh to apologise and take down posts promoting the upcoming film.

Karisma Kapoor thanks fans for support in first post after ex Sunjay Kapur's deathActor Karisma Kapoor, who turned 51 on June 25, thanked everyone for their birthday wishes.  This was her first post after the death of her ex-husband, Sunjay Kapur.

Approved by God: Sabrina Carpenter shares alternate cover for Man's Best FriendSinger Sabrina Carpenter shared an alternate album cover for her album 'Man's Best Friend'. The album is expected to be released on August 26.

Anshula wishes hope for brother Arjun Kapoor on birthday, appreciates his quiet loveSocial media influencer Anshula Kapoor wished Bollywood actor Arjun Kapoor on the occasion of his birthday on June 26. She appreciated his quiet love in a post on Instagram.

Exclusive: Kajol calls Alia Bhatt the most promising star of new generation'Maa' actor Kajol commented on the way Gen-Z actors work in the film industry. In an exclusive interview with us, she also appreciated Alia Bhatt for proving her mettle in Bollywood.

Sonakshi Sinha's Nikita Roy release postponed to avoid screen battle'Nikita Roy', an upcoming Bollywood film starring Sonakshi Sinha, was scheduled to release on June 27. The release has now been postponed, due to "battle of screens".

From ashes, we'll rebuild: Rupali Ganguly on Anupamaa set fireTV actor Rupali Ganguly issued a statement about the fire incident on the sets of her show 'Anupamaa.' In her statement, she thanked everyone for their prayers and extended solidarity to show producer Rajan Shahi.

Dekh rahe ho Binod: Panchayat's Ashok Pathak on becoming a breakout actorActor Ashok Pathak's role as Binod in the popular series 'Panchayat Season 4' has been nothing short of impressive. From his innocent expressions to the powerful climax scene, the actor gives us every reason to rate him among the standout performers of the season.

My life is not your content: Aishwarya Sharma on separation rumours with Neil BhattActor Aishwarya Sharma has strongly reacted to separation reports with Neil Bhatt. Aishwarya slammed the social media gossip around her personal life.

Kapil Sharma's show turns into a musical as Metro In Dino cast joins the funThe cast of 'Metro...In Dino' joined the fun on 'The Great Indian Kapil Show'. The episode will premiere on Netflix on June 28.

Actor Manoj Manchu wishes Kannappa team, omits Vishnu's name amid family feudActor Manoj Manchu wished his father, Mohan Babu, and the team of 'Kannappa', ahead of the film's release. However, he did not mention his brother Vishnu's name in the note, which came amid their family feud.

Eastern antagonism: Why American films and shows often cast Indians as villainsPriyanka Chopra, Ali Fazal and Naseeruddhn Shah are among the Indian actors who have acted in Hollywood. However, American cinema and shows are yet to break away with the colonial biases and exotic stereotypes around Indian characters. Here's a glimpse at the archetypes around South Asians, particularly Indians, in Western storytelling.

general news.headline: India suggests 4-pronged plan to China to manage border tensions, better tiesDefence Minister Rajnath Singh suggested a four-point formula to his Chinese counterpart, Admiral Dong Jun, during a bilateral meeting on the sidelines of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) in Qingdao, China.

Trump says China trade deal done, hints at 'very big' trade agreement with IndiaUS President Donald Trump announced a trade deal with China on rare earths and hinted at a major upcoming deal with India, aiming to strengthen US global trade ties and supply chain stability.

It looks easy, but my head is a little heavy: Shux on reaching Space StationShubhanshu Shukla, who became the first Indian astronaut to reach the International Space Station, said his head felt a little heavy but looked forward to conducting scientific research in the next two weeks.

Iran rules out nuclear talks with US next week, rejects Trump's claimIran ruled out talks with the United States next week, with Foreign Minister Araghchi citing significant damage from recent strikes on nuclear sites and saying Tehran is reassessing its diplomatic strategy.

Does coach Gautam Gambhir really have a problem with Rishabh Pant?Did coach Gautam Gambhir really take a dig at Rishabh Pant, or are we just reading too much into a grumpy press conference after the Leeds Test? Turns out, the internet may have spun a spicy feud out of a classic Gambhir moment.

RSS leader pitches for removal of words 'socialist', 'secular' from PreambleRSS General Secretary Dattatreya Hosabale strongly pitched whether the words 'secular' and 'socialist' - added by the Congress government to the Preamble of Constitution during Emergency - should remain.
Video: Massive fire breaks out at Noida private firm, plume of smoke fills airFire tenders have reached the location and firefighting operations are currently underway.

They should be prosecuted: Trump claims Democrats leaked US Intel on IranDonald Trump accused Democrats of leaking classified intel on Iran strikes, demanding prosecution. The FBI is investigating, but no evidence has been presented linking the leak to any specific individual or party.

I think he likes me: Trump embraces 'daddy' nickname from Nato chiefTrump was called "daddy" by NATO chief Mark Rutte at the 2025 summit, sparking laughter. Rutte later clarified it referred to the US role in NATO, not Trump personally.
Meril Launches MyClip, India's First Transcatheter-Edge-to-Edge Repair (TEER) SystemThe launch of MyClip TEER System marks a transformative moment for structural heart therapy in India.

India rejects UN help in Air India crash probe: ReportIndia declined a UN aviation investigator's offer to assist in the Air India crash probe that killed 274. Previously, the International Civil Aviation Organisation has deployed investigators to help with certain probe

Dutch man flies to Bengal to meet online friend, lands in police trouble insteadDutch national Henricks met a girl, not knowing she was a minor, through social media and their friendship grew so much so that Henrick decided to meet her and left Amsterdam for India last Sunday.

From Shah to Supreme Leader: Iran's Islamic revolution unfolds | Part 3In the concluding part of our series on US-Iran relations, we examine the Shah's push for modernisation, the emergence of Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini, and the 1979 Islamic Revolution that transformed Iran and its relationship with the United States.

Hindu temple razed in Bangladesh, India says extremists clamoured for demolitionA makeshift Durga temple in Dhaka was razed as part of a demolition drive, a move criticised by India, saying Bangladesh's interim government projected the incident as "illegal land use" and "extremists" clamouring for the demolition of the structure.

Rahul Gandhi may be wrong on Maharashtra poll fixing, but EC must come clean with dataThe Congress leader's poll-rigging claims lack solid proof, yet the poll panel must counter with data-backed transparency to preserve trust in India's electoral process

From his innocent expressions to the powerful climax scene, the actor gives us every reason to rate him among the standout performers of the season.

New York Mayor officially announces reelection bid alongside Jewish community leadersNew York Mayor Eric Adams launches independent reelection bid after legal woes, targeting Zohran Mamdani in a heated race for City Hall.

No intention to sideline India: Bangladesh denies forming alliance with China, PakBangladesh, China and Pakistan held an 'informal trilateral meeting' on the sidelines of two Beijing-sponsored regional events, the China-South Asia Exposition and the China-South Asia Cooperation Forum in Kunming.

India's 2036 Olympics hopes on hold: New IOC president pauses bidding processNew IOC President Kirsty Coventry announces a pause and review of the Olympic host city selection process. The decision comes at a time when India has emerged as one of the leading contenders to host the 2036 Summer Games.

Squid Game Season 3: Front man's identity fuels deadly showdown in final chapterSquid Game Season 3, the final chapter, premieres June 27 on Netflix. With only six episodes, it continues Gi-hun's battle against the Front Man in the deadliest round of games yet.

Can AIADMK-BJP alliance hold till Tamil Nadu polls in 2026?Why the next crisis—perhaps a statement by the BJP's K. Annamalai, a dispute over seats or a cultural row like the Murugan conference video—may well determine the fate

'America's Sharma ji ka beta' memes explode after Zohran Mamdani's NYC primary winZohran Mamdani made history as the first Muslim nominee of the Democrats after former Governor Andrew Cuomo conceded the race on Wednesday.

No evidence Iran moved enriched uranium before strikes: US defence chiefUS Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth says no intel shows Iran moved uranium before US strikes, amid scrutiny over nuclear setback claims.

sports.headline: Ex-India coach backs Yashasvi Jaiswal after Leeds fielding nightmareFormer India fielding coach R Sridhar has come out in support of Yashasvi Jaiswal after the young opener faced heavy criticism for his fielding lapses during the first Test between India and England at Headingley, Leeds.

ICC defines exact powerplay overs in shortened T20s after Test rules overhaulThe International Cricket Council has announced new powerplay rules for shortened T20 matches, clearly defining the number of overs allowed upfront with a restricted field in its updated Playing Conditions for the shortest format.

Australia take upper hand after contentious umpiring calls on day 2Australia carved out an 82-run lead over the West Indies on day two of the first Test in Barbados, with the hosts left frustrated by a series of close umpiring calls that went against them.

Sachin Tendulkar has asked me to come back on right track: Prithvi ShawIndia batter Prithvi Shaw has revealed that legendary batter Sachin Tendulkar has urged him to return to the right track amid the tumultuous period in his career.

Does coach Gautam Gambhir really have a problem with Rishabh Pant?Did coach Gautam Gambhir really take a dig at Rishabh Pant, or are we just reading too much into a grumpy press conference after the Leeds Test? Turns out, the internet may have spun a spicy feud out of a classic Gambhir moment.

Shami criticises India's bowling in Leeds, asks for more support for BumrahIndia fast bowler Mohammed Shami has criticised team's bowling during the first Test against England at Headingley in Leeds and asked for more support for the pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah.

India's 2036 Olympics hopes on hold: New IOC president pauses bidding processNew IOC President Kirsty Coventry announces a pause and review of the Olympic host city selection process. The decision comes at a time when India has emerged as one of the leading contenders to host the 2036 Summer Games.

Didn't want to watch Alcaraz vs Sinner French Open final: Novak DjokovicNovak Djokovic revealed he didn't intend to watch the French Open final between Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner, but eventually gave in—and was left stunned by the level of tennis on display.

Determined as ever, PV Sindhu working on keeping pace with changing women's gameP V Sindhu is reinventing her game to keep pace with the evolving tempo while navigating a challenging lean phase. In the ongoing year, Sindhu has endured four first-round exits and three second-round losses, with a lone quarterfinal appearance at the India Open.

Ravi Shastri demands bigger cut of ICC earnings for IndiaFormer India cricketer and head coach Ravi Shastri feels India should get an even bigger share of the ICC's (International Cricket Council) revenue, given their massive contribution to the board's coffers.

New cricket rules explained: Stop clock, catch of no-ball, replacement playerThe ICC has introduced several rule changes including a stop clock in Test cricket and tweaks to the saliva ban. The global body of cricket will also allow first-class teams across the world to allow injury replacements.

India's 2036 Olympics hopes on hold: New IOC president pauses bidding processNew IOC President Kirsty Coventry announces a pause and review of the Olympic host city selection process. The decision comes at a time when India has emerged as one of the leading contenders to host the 2036 Summer Games.

In the ongoing year, Sindhu has endured four first-round exits and three second-round losses, with a lone quarterfinal appearance at the India Open.

New cricket rules explained: Stop clock, catch of no-ball, replacement playerThe ICC has introduced several rule changes including a stop clock in Test cricket and tweaks to the saliva ban. The global body of cricket will also allow first-class teams across the world to allow injury replacements.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
